TITLE: Highbrow Films Aimed at Winning Oscars Are Losing Audiences
SUMMARY: The kind of critically praised dramas that often dominate the awards season are falling flat at the box office, failing to justify the money it takes to make them.

TITLE: Qatar Extends Its Natural Gas Dominance at Russia’s Expense
SUMMARY: As its influence grows, the country is poised to become a big energy supplier to Europe, which has turned away from Russia after its invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: Workers at E.V. Battery Plant in Ohio Vote to Unionize
SUMMARY: The result, at a plant owned by General Motors and a South Korean company, is a milestone for the auto union in organizing electric vehicle workers.

TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried Agrees to Testify Before House Committee
SUMMARY: The FTX founder said on Twitter that he will appear before a House committee next week, but was quiet about a similar request from a Senate committee.

TITLE: Lina Khan, Aiming to Block Microsoft’s Activision Deal, Faces a Challenge
SUMMARY: Ms. Khan, the chair of the Federal Trade Commission, has staked an ambitious trustbusting agenda on a case that may be difficult to win.

TITLE: Oil Prices Drop, Despite Heightened Sanctions on Russian Crude
SUMMARY: The price of oil fell by about 10 percent this week, easing (for now) supply worries about the E.U. embargo and a price cap.

TITLE: How Bad Are Microplastics? An Expert Weighs In.
SUMMARY: “We’re becoming aware that they’re everywhere.” An environmental researcher weighs in on the little particles that break away from the everyday plastic items in our lives.

TITLE: ‘I Will Keep Fighting’: China’s Protesters Say It’s Bigger Than Covid
SUMMARY: The restrictions that drove people into the streets last month are being rolled back. But many of those who demonstrated say they want more.

TITLE: Inside the Frantic Texts Exchanged by Crypto Executives as FTX Collapsed
SUMMARY: A group chat including crypto leaders shows Binance’s Changpeng Zhao accusing FTX’s Sam Bankman-Fried of orchestrating trades to destabilize the industry.

TITLE: Markets Fluctuate at the End of a Shaky Week
SUMMARY: Persistent pullbacks in recent sessions reflect investors’ worries about stubbornly high inflation.

TITLE: Turkey Is Strengthening Its Energy Ties With Russia
SUMMARY: As Moscow seeks new customers for oil, gas and coal, Ankara is a willing buyer as it promotes plans as a regional trading hub.

TITLE: After a Terrible Year for Bonds, the Outlook Is Better
SUMMARY: October capped their worst 12-month period ever, and the economy is under pressure. Yet the fundamental math of bond returns bodes well for 2023, our columnist says.

TITLE: A Guide to Signing Up for Health Coverage
SUMMARY: With the deadline near for marketplace medical insurance, a video offers some down-to-earth advice for navigating numerous options and obscure terms.

TITLE: The FTC’s Bet on Rewriting Antitrust by Taking on Microsoft
SUMMARY: In seeking to oppose the $69 billion takeover of Activision Blizzard, the agency is hoping to revamp the nation’s antitrust rules — even if it loses.

TITLE: A Rural Hospital’s Excruciating Choice: $3.2 Million a Year or Inpatient Care?
SUMMARY: A new federal program offers hefty payments to small hospitals at risk of closing. But it comes with a bewildering requirement.

TITLE: Beijing Braces for Covid Surge After China Lifts Pandemic Curbs
SUMMARY: Residents lined up at hospitals and pharmacies, seeking help for fevers and buying at-home tests after the government’s decision to ease its “zero Covid” policy.

TITLE: Biden Devotes $36 Billion to Save Union Workers’ Pensions
SUMMARY: The money comes from last year’s Covid-19 relief package and will avert cuts of up to 60 percent in pensions for 350,000 Teamster truck drivers, warehouse and construction workers and food processors.

TITLE: FTC Sues to Block Microsoft’s $69 Billion Acquisition of Activision
SUMMARY: The move by the commission signals an aggressive stance by federal regulators to thwart the expansion of the tech industry’s biggest companies.

TITLE: Meta Battles F.T.C. in Court Over Future of Virtual Reality
SUMMARY: A trial that began Thursday will serve as a test of the Federal Trade Commission’s argument that Facebook’s parent company is trying to buy its way to dominance in the nascent virtual and augmented reality markets.

TITLE: The Villain So Far in ‘Harry & Meghan’? Not the Royal Family.
SUMMARY: Harry and Meghan focused their ire in their Netflix documentary on the tabloids they say have hounded them out of remorseless greed and scarcely concealed racism.

TITLE: Yellen Is First Female Treasury Secretary With Signature on U.S. Dollar
SUMMARY: Two women — the first female Treasury secretary and the first Native American to serve as U.S. treasurer — now have their signatures on America’s currency.

TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried Faces Federal Inquiry Into Market Manipulation
SUMMARY: A federal investigation into whether the FTX founder’s trading firm illicitly manipulated the markets for two crypto tokens compounds his troubles.

TITLE: UK Approves New Coal Mine, Despite Climate Concerns
SUMMARY: Local politicians said the facility, the country’s first new coal mine in decades, would create hundreds of jobs.

TITLE: How Will China Turn Its Economy Back On? The World Is About to Find Out.
SUMMARY: Strict “zero Covid” curbs have been smothering growth. After easing them, Beijing faces the twin challenges of rising caseloads and wary consumers.

TITLE: In Appalachia, Margo Miller Leads from “a Place of Courageous Joy”
SUMMARY: Ms. Miller’s work has made her one of the most powerful people in philanthropy in a rapidly evolving region that has long been marred by stereotypes.

TITLE: State Officials Seek to Revisit Sports-Betting Arrangements
SUMMARY: Officials in New York, Kansas and elsewhere are voicing new concerns about the rise of online sports betting after a series of articles in The Times examined it.

TITLE: East Fork Pottery’s CEO Has Stepped Down. What Will Happen to the Brand?
SUMMARY: Since East Fork started in 2009, its fans have been drawn to a founder’s frank and candid style of communication. Can it stay transparent in a muddy world?

TITLE: Gasoline Price Falls Below Year Ago Level
SUMMARY: A visible symbol of inflation for much of the year, prices at the pump have been driven down by reduced global demand and tumbling oil prices.

TITLE: A Long Road to Renewal for Former Military Bases
SUMMARY: Closed defense sites are like snowflakes in that no two are alike. The efforts to redevelop two New Jersey forts show the obstacles to revitalization.

TITLE: Liz Garbus on Making the Harry and Meghan Netflix Series ‘Personal and Raw’
SUMMARY: The documentary series is the most high-profile project from Story Syndicate, a company run by the filmmaker Liz Garbus and her husband, Dan Cogan.

TITLE: Away From the Spotlight, a Debate Rages Over a Postwar Ukraine Economy
SUMMARY: Beyond the enormous cost of rebuilding the country are difficult and delicate choices about how to best connect the nation to European markets and commerce.

TITLE: From the DealBook Summit: Leaders Look Into the Future
SUMMARY: Groundbreakers at the conference were asked what’s coming next for the brain, climate, medicine, labor, security and business.

TITLE: Can Fashion Be Profitable Without Growth?
SUMMARY: Industry leaders said the goal of sustainability wouldn’t happen without changes to the business model and more efforts to educate consumers.

TITLE: The Risks of ‘Yes, and’ Leadership
SUMMARY: Recent years have demanded that C.E.O.s accept uncertainty. Some have taken that to extremes.

TITLE: There’s a Lot of Entertainment Content. Where Do Profits Come From?
SUMMARY: A DealBook task force debated where and how the film, television and theater industries can make money from their productions.

TITLE: In China, Luxury Shopping Faces Ongoing Headwinds
SUMMARY: China’s zero-Covid policy has weighed heavily on the high-end market in 2022. In the wake of recent protests, is a recovery in sight?

TITLE: Can News Be Made Into a Sustainable Business?
SUMMARY: For a DealBook task force, a lack of trust, political polarization and a troubled business model are among the news industry’s challenges.

TITLE: How Streaming Has Rewritten the Script for Movies
SUMMARY: As a business and a cultural pursuit, Hollywood is in a state of chaos that has been growing year by year.

TITLE: At the DealBook Summit, Untangling the Now — and the Future
SUMMARY: In challenging times, choosing the direction of a company can be a lot like shifting pieces of a puzzle — with sometimes staggering consequences.

TITLE: For C.E.O.s, Communication Has Become a High-Wire Act
SUMMARY: Business leaders said the tumult of recent years had made it more important than ever to share with employees and the public. But how much, and when?

TITLE: Pentagon Gives Cloud Contracts to Amazon, Google, Microsoft and Oracle
SUMMARY: Contracts that could total $9 billion were awarded to Amazon, Google, Microsoft and Oracle. An earlier effort, won by Microsoft, was scrapped after rivals objected.

TITLE: New York Times Union Holds One-Day Strike
SUMMARY: Negotiators for the company and the union, which represents most of the newsroom, have failed to come to an agreement on salaries, health and retirement benefits, and other issues.

TITLE: FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried Faces Market Manipulation Inquiry
SUMMARY: Federal prosecutors are investigating whether Sam Bankman-Fried and his hedge fund orchestrated trades in a way that led to the collapse of two cryptocurrencies in May.

TITLE: Sunny Balwani, No. 2 Theranos Executive, Is Sentenced for Fraud
SUMMARY: Ramesh Balwani, the former chief operating officer of the failed blood testing start-up, was convicted of 12 counts of fraud in July.

TITLE: US Proposes Global Green Steel Club That Would Put Tariffs on China
SUMMARY: A concept paper sent to the European Union suggests a new trade approach to tax metal made with higher carbon emissions in countries like China.

TITLE: Indiana Sues TikTok for Security and Child Safety Violations
SUMMARY: The lawsuits are the first by an American state against TikTok, which is owned by the Chinese company ByteDance, in a sign of mounting legal pressure.

TITLE: Lasik Patients Should Be Warned of Complications, FDA Draft Says
SUMMARY: Draft recommendations by the agency describe dry eyes, visual disturbances and other side effects of the procedure. Surgeons say the benefits are being ignored.

TITLE: An Activist Investor Takes On BlackRock Over E.S.G.
SUMMARY: A hedge fund sees BlackRock’s embrace of E.S.G. principles as a distraction, and it wants the money-management giant’s C.E.O., Laurence Fink, to step down.

TITLE: UK Braces for Strikes Across Several Industries Through Christmas
SUMMARY: Job actions by ambulance staff, nurses, rail workers and others will hit Britain every day between now and Dec. 25.

TITLE: India Chases Clean Energy, but Economic Goals Put Coal First
SUMMARY: “I will not compromise on the availability of power,” India’s energy minister has declared in defense of fossil fuel use, which is heavily subsidized.

TITLE: Why Losing to Meta in Court Could Still Be a Win for Antitrust Regulators
SUMMARY: As the Federal Trade Commission prepares to face off in court against Meta over a V.R. start-up deal, the agency is testing a novel argument as part of a strategy to push antitrust law.

TITLE: Chamath Palihapitiya, The ‘SPAC King,’ Is Over It
SUMMARY: Chamath Palihapitiya, once a relentless cheerleader of special purpose acquisition companies, blames the Federal Reserve for the end of SPAC mania.

TITLE: China’s ‘Zero Covid’ Policy Changes, Explained
SUMMARY: The Chinese government ordered officials to cut back on mass testing and hair-trigger regional lockdowns, in a pivot from stringent pandemic rules.

TITLE: Twitter’s Rivals, Including Meta, Try to Capitalize on Musk-Induced Chaos
SUMMARY: New start-ups and other social platforms sense opportunity as Twitter grapples with changes from Elon Musk, its new owner.

TITLE: China Eases ‘Zero Covid’ Restrictions in Victory for Protesters
SUMMARY: Beijing’s costly policy of lockdowns has pummeled the world’s second-largest economy and set off mass public protests that were a rare challenge to China’s leader, Xi Jinping.

TITLE: Juul Agrees to Settle Thousands of Vaping Lawsuits
SUMMARY: The deal is the latest in the company’s efforts to resolve litigation over its marketing of products that some contend fueled the teenage vaping crisis.

TITLE: Trump Organization Is Guilty of Tax Fraud in Blow to the Former President
SUMMARY: Prosecutors did not indict the former president, but they invoked him throughout the monthlong trial. The Trump Organization had been his springboard to fame and power.

TITLE: Strikes Across Iran Lead to Shuttered Shops and Ghost Towns
SUMMARY: Activists say it is the next phase in an uprising that began in September, after the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in the custody of the morality police.

TITLE: Morgan Stanley Cuts 2% of Global Work Force as Deal-Making Slows
SUMMARY: The Wall Street firm had paused layoffs during the pandemic, as deal activity spiked industrywide. The layoffs will affect workers across all divisions.
